comments.body: I think we will enable this in test-infra, could you please explain a bit how will test-infra expect to trigger in your mind?
you mean test this in e2e test? no, it's for whoever interested in triggering the comparison to debug. Nothing would happen except some logs are appended.

I saw it was mentioned in the issue description: 
> We will probably enable it in our tests and in clusters where customers see stale cache issues

Anyway this question will not block this PR. I will re-lgtm it when CI passed.

@resouer, Your point is valid. In fact, I also chatted with @anfernee on Slack about periodic triggering of this or enabling it in tests. I believe we should try this feature and make sure that we do not see a lot of false positives. We should also measure its performance overhead in larger tests to ensure that enabling it in tests won't cause timeouts. Once it is refined, we may want to enable it in certain tests.
